requirements:
Basic To-Do List Website named boba Requirements
User Interface:

Simple input field to add new tasks quickly.

List display area showing tasks clearly.

Checkboxes or toggles to mark tasks as completed.

Edit and delete options for existing tasks.

Responsive design for use on both desktop and mobile devices.

Task Management:

Ability to add, edit, and delete tasks.

Mark tasks as complete or incomplete.

Option to prioritize or categorize tasks.

Save tasks persistently (local storage or backend database).

User Experience:

Clear visual differentiation between completed and pending tasks.

Easy navigation and intuitive controls.

Option to reorder tasks by drag and drop or priority.

Technical Requirements:

Responsive front-end using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

Optional backend for user authentication and task storage (using database).

Cross-browser compatibility.

Performance optimized for fast load and smooth interactions.

functional_requirements.description: As a user, I want to add a new task to my to-do list so I can keep track of what I need to do.
acceptance_criteria: User can type a task description into an input field.
Pressing 'Enter' or clicking an 'Add' button adds the new task to the list.
The input field is cleared after the task is added.

functional_requirements.description: As a user, I want to see all my tasks in a list so I can view my workload at a glance.
acceptance_criteria: All added tasks are displayed in a list format.
Each task in the list clearly shows its description.
Completed tasks are visually distinct from pending tasks (e.g., strikethrough text, different color).

functional_requirements.description: As a user, I want to mark tasks as complete or incomplete to track my progress.
acceptance_criteria: Each task has a checkbox or a toggle button next to it.
Clicking the checkbox marks the task as completed.
Clicking the checkbox again marks the task as incomplete.

functional_requirements.description: As a user, I want to edit the description of an existing task to correct mistakes or add details.
acceptance_criteria: Each task has an 'Edit' button.
Clicking the 'Edit' button makes the task description editable in-place.
Saving the changes updates the task in the list.

functional_requirements.description: As a user, I want to delete a task when it is no longer needed.
acceptance_criteria: Each task has a 'Delete' button.
Clicking the 'Delete' button permanently removes the task from the list.
A confirmation prompt may appear before deletion to prevent accidental removal.

functional_requirements.description: As a user, I want my tasks to be saved so I don't lose them when I close the application.
acceptance_criteria: Tasks are saved in the browser's LocalStorage.
Tasks persist even after the browser tab is closed and reopened.
The application correctly loads existing tasks from LocalStorage on startup.

functional_requirements.description: As a user, I want the website to be responsive so I can manage my tasks on any device.
acceptance_criteria: The application layout adjusts gracefully to different screen sizes, including desktop, tablet, and mobile.
All functionality is accessible and usable on touch devices.
Text and interactive elements are readable and easy to click on all screen sizes.

functional_requirements.description: As a user, I want to reorder my tasks to prioritize them according to my needs.
acceptance_criteria: Users can reorder tasks in the list.
Reordering can be achieved via drag-and-drop functionality.
The new order of tasks is saved persistently.

non_functional_requirements.description: The web application should load quickly and provide a smooth user experience.
metrics: Initial page load time under 2 seconds.
UI updates (add, edit, delete) should feel instantaneous (under 100ms).

non_functional_requirements.description: The application must be intuitive and easy to use for non-technical users.
metrics: A new user can add and complete a task within 30 seconds without instructions.
The application should adhere to basic accessibility standards (WCAG 2.1 Level A).

non_functional_requirements.description: The application must function correctly across different web browsers.
metrics: Full support for the latest two versions of Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox, Apple Safari, and Microsoft Edge.

non_functional_requirements.description: The codebase should be clean, well-structured, and easy to modify for future enhancements.
metrics: Follows a consistent coding style (e.g., using a linter like ESLint).
Code is organized into logical modules/files.

backend: Node.js (with Express.js) - Optional, for future user accounts and database sync
Firebase - Optional, as a Backend-as-a-Service for easier setup
database: PostgreSQL or MongoDB - Optional, if a backend is implemented
devops: GitHub Pages, Netlify, or Vercel (for static hosting)

risks: Scope Creep: Requests for additional features like user accounts, task sharing, or calendar integration could significantly increase complexity.
Data Loss: Since data is stored in LocalStorage, users can accidentally lose all their tasks by clearing their browser data.
Cross-Browser Issues: Minor visual or functional inconsistencies may arise between different browsers despite testing.
assumptions: The initial version will use browser LocalStorage for data persistence, a backend is not required for the MVP.
User authentication and multi-user support are out of scope for this project.
The application must be compatible with the latest versions of major modern browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge).
A minimalistic UI/UX design is sufficient; no complex graphical assets or animations are required.
Task categorization will be implemented as a simple text-based label system.
